\title{Friction Factor and Heat Transfer Coefficient \{Todreas\}}

\maketitle

\section{Friction Factor}

The changes in the friction factor are given by the moody chart:

\begin{figure}[H]
\begin{centering}
\input{img/Moody_Chart.tex}
\par\end{centering}

\protect\caption{The Moody Chart}


\end{figure}



\section{Heat Transfer Coefficient}

The heat transfer coefficient can be found from the Nusselt number,
because $Nu\equiv\frac{hD}{k}$. For laminar flow, this is given as:
\begin{itemize}
\item Laminar Flow
\[
Nu=4.364
\]
\footnote{Assuming constant $q^{''}$ and a circular cross section}
\item Turbulent Flow - the Dittus-Boelter Correlation

\begin{itemize}
\item Heating
\[
Nu=0.026Re^{0.8}Pr^{0.4}
\]

\item Cooling
\[
Nu=0.026Re^{0.8}Pr^{0.3}
\]

\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\begin{figure}[H]
\begin{centering}
\input{img/Turbulent_Heat_Transfer_Chart.tex}
\par\end{centering}

\protect\caption{Nusselt Number versus Reynold's Number with Varying Prandtl Numbers}


\end{figure}
